section.title: Part A: Career Interests
section.subtitle: WHAT EXCITES YOU? - Discover your Holland Code (RIASEC)
section.description: Answer based on what naturally interests youâ€”not what you think you should like.

domains.name: Realistic
domains.description: Practical & Hands-on - Working with tools, machines, or nature

domains.name: Artistic
domains.description: Creative & Expressive - Art, music, writing, design

domains.name: Social
domains.description: Helping & Teaching - Supporting, guiding, healing others

questions.text: I enjoy solving practical problems by building, fixing, or putting things together.
I like questions that need careful logic and evidence to answer.
I feel energised when I can express ideas in an original way.
I find meaning in helping people learn, heal, or grow.
I like persuading others and guiding a group toward a goal.
I feel satisfied when information is organised and systems run smoothly.
I prefer hands-on tasks to long discussions about ideas.
I enjoy analysing data to understand patterns and causes.
I dislike work that requires imagination or creative risk.
I am not very interested in teaching or supporting others.
I avoid taking charge or influencing group decisions.
I find detailed paperwork and structured procedures calming.
I would rather work outdoors or with tools than sit in meetings all day.
I enjoy scientific thinkingâ€”testing ideas and checking what is true.
I prefer work that allows freedom over strict rules.
I notice when someone is struggling and want to support them.
I'm motivated by achievement, competition, and measurable results.
I like planning steps carefully and following a clear process.
I feel confident using equipment, tools, or technology in practical ways.
I enjoy complex problems that require deep concentration.
Repetitive routines drain me, even if they are efficient.
I enjoy explaining ideas in a way that helps others understand.
I enjoy negotiating or selling an idea to win support.
I prefer clear instructions and stable routines at work.
I like work where results are physical and visible.
I lose interest when a task lacks intellectual challenge.
I enjoy exploring music, design, writing, or performance.
I prefer working with machines or tools more than working with people.
I often take initiative in groups and enjoy directing tasks.
I naturally keep track of details, deadlines, and records.
I dislike getting my hands dirty or working with equipment.
I enjoy reading or researching to understand how things work.
I prefer flexible, unstructured work over strict routines.
I enjoy mentoring, coaching, or guiding someone step-by-step.
I feel energised by leadership roles and responsibility.
I like work that involves checking accuracy and preventing errors.
I enjoy learning how machines, vehicles, or systems operate.
I am more interested in theory and ideas than practical application.
I would be happy in a job that lets me create something new every day.
I am good at listening and understanding how others feel.
I enjoy setting goals and pushing myself to achieve them.
I prefer following established methods rather than creating new ones.
I feel satisfied when I complete a physical task or project.
I enjoy asking questions and finding answers through research.
I value originality and self-expression in my work.
I would enjoy a career focused on helping people solve personal problems.
I am comfortable making quick decisions under pressure.
I enjoy tasks that require attention to detail and precision.
I like being active and moving around rather than sitting at a desk.
I am curious about why things happen and how systems work.
I prefer tasks with clear rules over open-ended creative projects.
I enjoy working in teams where I can collaborate with others.
I like convincing people to see things my way.
I feel comfortable working with numbers, spreadsheets, and databases.
I would enjoy working in construction, engineering, or manufacturing.
I find abstract theories and concepts fascinating.
I would love a career in the arts, entertainment, or creative industries.
I am drawn to careers in education, healthcare, or social services.
I am attracted to business, entrepreneurship, or management roles.
I would enjoy a career in finance, administration, or data management.

hollandCodeInfo.description: Your top 3 codes combine to form your Holland Code (e.g., RIA, SEC, AIC)
